title: The Open Floor Plan: Tearing Down Walls
description: A quick, practical guide to The Open Floor Plan: Tearing Down Walls.

hook.text: Kitchens used to be hidden rooms for servants. Now they're the center of every home. What changed?

buildup.text: After WWII, homes shrank and servants vanished. Families needed kitchens connected to living spaces.

discovery.text: Frank Lloyd Wright pioneered open plans in the 1930s, flowing one room into the next without walls.

punchline.text: Walls come and go. How we live decides.

quiz.question: What social change drove the open floor plan's popularity?
options: Disappearance of domestic servants and smaller homes
